## ConnectionChecker.canConnectWithReason() method

Checks whether the current connection can connect with the target connection, and return an error code if there are problems.

**Signature:**

```typescript
canConnectWithReason(a: Connection | null, b: Connection | null, isDragging: boolean, opt_distance?: number): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  a | [Connection](./blockly.connection.md) \| null | Connection to check compatibility with. |
|  b | [Connection](./blockly.connection.md) \| null | Connection to check compatibility with. |
|  isDragging | boolean | True if the connection is being made by dragging a block. |
|  opt\_distance | number | _(Optional)_ The max allowable distance between the connections for drag checks. |

**Returns:**

number

Connection.CAN\_CONNECT if the connection is legal, an error code otherwise.
